name: baccalaureate
content:

(informal abbreviation bac) an exam in several subjects taken in the last year of school around the age of 18 in France and some other countries: I was studying for my baccalaureate and hoping to go to university. She argues in favour of moving to a baccalaureate system, where students are able to take a wider range of subjects rather than specializing at 16. See also
the International Baccalaureate
mainly US (also baccalaureate degree) a bachelor's degree (= a first degree at college or university): Students can opt for a two-year associate degree or a four-year baccalaureate. Getting a baccalaureate degree has often been seen as the route to well-paid employment.
More examplesFewer examplesAt that time, anyone who passed the baccalaureate (equivalent to A levels) had the right to go to university.In Hungary they don't do A levels; they call it a Baccalaureate. Several more baccalaureate and master's degree programs have been created.
